The request to the W® K® Kellogg Foundation for a three-year grant (for the period
July 1, 1956-June 30, 1959), end the terms of the subsequent grant, stipulated
that, of the total proposed annual budget for Headquarters (items of which were to
remain firm over the three-year period, esjoept for salaries), 03,81*0 was to be ob¬
tained from income other than the grant (such as the sale of publications, reimbur¬
sable services, etc.). It was felt last year that this amount should in increased,
however slightly, as an indication of the efforts being mads to achieve self-support.
Therefore, 01,100 was so allocated last year and again this year.
